Type.Name: Icon

TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit Icon extends System.Object

Type.ThreadSafetyStatement: Gtk# is thread aware, but not thread safe; See the Gtk# Thread Programming for details.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed
.method public static hidebysig valuetype Gtk.IconSize SizeFromName(string name) cil managed

Docs.summary: Looks up the icon size associated with .
Docs.returns: The icon size with the given name.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig string SizeGetName(valuetype Gtk.IconSize size) cil managed

Docs.summary: Obtains the canonical name of the given icon size.
Docs.returns: The name of the given icon size.

remarks.para: The returned string is statically allocated and should not be freed.

MemberSignature.Value: public static bool SizeLookup (Gtk.IconSize size, out int width, out int height);
.method public static hidebysig bool SizeLookup(valuetype Gtk.IconSize size, int32 width, int32 height) cil managed

Docs.summary: Obtains the pixel size of a semantic icon size, possibly modified by user preferences fot the default .

remarks.para: Normally size would be , , etc. This method is not normally needed, is the usual way to get an icon for rendering, then just look at the size of the rendered pixbuf. The rendered pixbuf may not even correspond to the width/height returned by , because themes are free to render the pixbuf however they like, including changing the usual size.

MemberSignature.Value: public static bool SizeLookupForSettings (Gtk.Settings settings, Gtk.IconSize size, out int width, out int height);
.method public static hidebysig bool SizeLookupForSettings(class Gtk.Settings settings, valuetype Gtk.IconSize size, int32 width, int32 height) cil managed

Docs.param: A object, used to determine which set of user preferences to use.
Docs.summary: Obtains the pixel size of a semantic icon size, possibly modified by user preferences for a particular .

remarks.para: Normally size would be , , etc. This method is not normally needed, is the usual way to get an icon for rendering, then just look at the size of the rendered pixbuf. The rendered pixbuf may not even correspond to the width/height returned by , because themes are free to render the pixbuf however they like, including changing the usual size.
